item.title: Report E-2025020191
item.description:
Report E-2025020191

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T03:17:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-12
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 12, 2025, one (1) 600-pound pressurized tank of UN3500 was crushed in transit and released approximately 5-ounces of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3500-impacted loading dock floor. After remediating the product released on the pallet and loading dock, the crew utilized a forklift to move the leaking tank into an open well ventilated area. The damaged tank was labeled with a non-haz waste label and all impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

Report E-2025020184

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: Driver started dropping fuel and it started following out of the vapor recovery at the hose connection. Estimated 15 gallons of product was release. Investigation determined that the flap was defective. Our customer will be reimbursing us for the cleanup costs.
